Package pds.cvSvc

Attempts to detect objects such as the table, ping pong ball, and ping pong rackets.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BackgroundElimination  
    BallStore
    A data structure for storing the raw contours of moving objects.
    ConvertFrameNode
    Allows for fast conversion of a color VLC FrameNode to a grayscale Mat usable in OpenCV
    CVFrame
    Immutable class that allows for single conversion of a VLCJ FrameNode to a CVFrame for use with OpenCV
    CVStores
    A struct-like container for all the different OpenCV output stores
    DetectBall
    Offers a means of detecting a moving ball
    DetectTable
    Determines whether or not enough of a ping pong table is in view for further analysis
    DiffMotion
    Quick method of detecting motion between two frames based on summed, gated difference.
    DiffStore
    A data structure for storing the raw sum-values of the DiffMotion algorithm.
    ExtractObjectCandidates  
    Lines  
    LineStore
    Stores detected line data & provides access
    MatDisplay
    Provides a means to easily display OpenCV Mats
    TableStore
    A data structure for storing raw contour data from the DetectTable algorithm.

Package pds.cvSvc Description

Attempts to detect objects such as the table, ping pong ball, and ping pong rackets. Currently we use the OpenCV library to accomplish this. Each computer vision algorithm can also run in its own thread for performance optimization. Thus inputs and outputs are passed as construction parameters, and each class is Runnable.
